content.prompt: The point of view expressed in the excerpt could best be used to support which of the following historical arguments about the late 1800s?

choices.label: Manufacturing workers blamed business leaders for class conflict in society.
Reformers sought to use religion to reduce discord between workers and employers.
Labor union organizers championed alternatives to laissez-faire capitalism.
Critics of the Gilded Age economy pointed to social scientific studies about wealth inequality.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
